result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Marquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Orlando Marquez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Orlando Marquez was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: On or Near a School], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Perform 50 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.

records.addlTxt:
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty Carl Johnson.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1028 - Parties have rec'd and reviewed PSI. Sentence recommendations.  Defendant is sentenced to 15 years in the WSP; 8 years Initial Confinement followed by 7 years of Extended Supervision.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 81 days credit. DE to perform 50 hours of community service upon release. Court costs ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given. DE taken into custody in court.
At the request of Atty Johnson, SEH rescheduled to 4/26 @ 10:30am. Attys to confirm new date by email.
